title: How to Make Soap Jelly

steps.headline: Keep the end pieces of soap in a container somewhere.
steps.description: Under the kitchen sink is a nice, out of the way place. When you have about 1 US-pint (473 ml) or 2 cups of soap pieces, you are ready to make soap jelly.

steps.headline: Grate or shave the soap pieces as much as possible.
steps.description: For the pieces that get too small, simply throw them in to melt down but make sure they as small as possible.

steps.headline: Add one pint or half a litre of boiling water to the grated soap pieces.
steps.description: Stir in one tablespoon of borax. Make sure that the soap pieces dissolve completely.

steps.headline: Stir and leave in a wide mouthed glass jar to gel as it turns cold.
Use as a cleaning soap.
steps.description: It is economical because every part of the soap gets used up.
